page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY _ POYNTINGTON
page.content: The most{ancient sign}of settlement in the area is the earthwork near Milborne Wick,a long barrow on Barrow Hill.An{old drove road}from Whitcombe to the mills at Milborne Port and Milborne Wick still exists as a footpath.On Seven Wells Down, Deadmans hill is linked with Old Mother Herne,a wise woman or{witch, whose cottage nearby has now vanished. On Poyntington hill it is said that there was a{cockfighting pit.}On the Milborne Port_Charlton Horethorne road near the now disused and converted railway station is Bulge farm,once the railway inn.A small chapel in Milborne Wick was built in 1890 and is still used.Isolated stone built closes are a feature of the farms in this area. {Place names}of interest:Milborne Wick _farm on the millstream; Poyntington_ Saxon for "farm of punt's people."
